bug.short_desc: The slice-image-job should be able to slice images for HBox-Decorators

long_desc.thetext:
The slice-image-job of the qooxdoo-generator seems to be optimized for grid-decorators. We would like to use this slice-image-job for an image that is used by the HBox-decorator, but have found some things that do not work so fine for the HBox-Images:
1. The slice-image-job always generates 9 images (-tl, -tr, -br, -bc, ...), but we need onlice 3 images for the HBox-decorator. Therefore we always have to delete these extra images manually.
2. The height of the slice "-r" of our HBox-decorator should be equal to the height of the image-template. This height of the slice "-r" should not be reduced be the height of the top-slice and the bottom-slice. We were able to reach this by setting the top-border-width and bottom-border-width to 0: border-width: [0, 68, 0, 68] But then we get the following warning when running the slice-image-job Magick: geometry does not contain image '...' @warning/transform.c/CropImage/620 This warning is generated by Image-Magick because the slice-image-job calls Image-Magick with the height 0.
Therefore I would recommend the following improvement of the slice-image-job: The slice-image-job should be able to handle 0 values for the height like: border-width: [0, 68, 0, 68] Then the slice-image-job should automatically detect that the height of the corresponding slices (-tl, -t, -tr, -bl, -b, -br) is 0 so that the slice-image-job does not have to call Image-Magick for these slices. The result would be that the slice-image-job would only generate 3 images (-l, -c, -r) and these images could be directly used for the HBox-Decorator
Daniel, pleas check the feedback. Havent we changed something in that area recently?

Yes, the fix for bug #2962 should cover these requirements. Uwe, if there's something I've missed, please reopen this report.
